data.title: A PRICE'S SECRET MARRIAGE.
data.meta_description: The secret marriage of Prince Aage of Denmark, a nephew of Queen Alexandra, to the Italian Countess Calvi di Bergolo at Turin, which took place on January 17, ...
data.text:
The secret marriage of Prince Aage of

Denmark, a nephew of Queen Alexandra,

to the Italian Countess Calvi di Bergola

at Turin, which took place on January 17,

was not publicly announced until some

time later, when an official statement was

issued at Copenhagen by order of the King

of Denmark and Prince Valdemar.

It ia a real marriage of affection (says a

London paper). The prince met his bride

some years ago, when her father, who is

now retired, was the Italian,Minister at

Copenhagen. The bride's family are not

rich, and own only a small castle and estate

in the neighborhood of Turin. The Calvis

were ennobled 100 years ago.

Prince Aage, who is 27 years of age and

is a lieutenant in the Danish Royal Guards,

is the eldest son of Prince Waldemar,

Queen Alexandra's youngest brother. The

young prince is very popular. His bride

is the same age, and is a tall, dark, beauti-

ful woman. None of the prince's relatives

were at the wedding. '
